conclusion: Analyze the motion of the bullets and the carts.
Each bullet is fired from Cart A with a speed v0 relative to the ground.
The bullets are fired every Δt0 time interval.
The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is s.
Cart A is moving to the left with speed v1.
Cart B is moving to the right with speed v2.
The speed of the bullet relative to the ground is v0 - v1 (to the right).
The relative speed of the bullet with respect to Cart B is v0 - v1 - v2.
The distance s can be expressed as s = (v0 - v1) Δt0.
The time t for a bullet to hit Cart B is t = s / (v0 - v1 - v2).
Since t = Δt0, the bullets hit Cart B at intervals of Δt0.
From s = (v0 - v1) Δt0, solve for s: s = (v0 - v1) Δt0.
The distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air is s = (v0 - v1) Δt0.
